channel.title: Does the source folder need to be in the client folder?
channel.description: I am having a parade of no main class errors in my client folder for the run.bat. It says cannot find server. So, me being the observant person I am, realized there is server.java file in the source folder. So it hit me "DOES THE SOURCE FOLDER NEED TO BE IN THE CLIENT FOLDER???" Can you answer that? :P

item.title: Does the source folder need to be in the client folder?
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Maybe the Run.bat has the wrong arguments, like for the Silabsoft client you need “live highmem 0 0” etc. Check that.

Read full topic
item.source: Does the source folder need to be in the client folder?
